Just be aware that every hole you create in the battery case can lead to water ingress.
I just had this happen on my self built ebike battery (20s - 7P)
What alerted me to a possible "issue" was if I gave it too many beans the controller would go into protect mode. (Shut down)
This usually means a cell terminal has broken loose so it was time to do a bit more investigating
I have an app called VBMS that measures all the voltages etc
If you look below temp sensor 4.
Look at "cell 1" voltage.
WTF ?
So I dismantled the case and found water has somehow got in and ruined the bottom bank of cells
https://i.imgur.com/e2cqyRm.jpg
Bah!
Fortunately it's only 7 cells but it's still a pain in the arse to dismantle - Fix - reprint a new lid (coz I bust the other one removing it) and reassemble

⚠️☝🏽 Louis, a simple tip for making the aluminum frames:if you cut a 90ª triangle only on a single side of the "L" you can make a frame of a single piece marking every side with its own messure, then you can bend the pieces togheter until every corner make contact with each other. this way you will have a "one piece frame" then later you can mount it all with aluminum rivets. HOpe it help, peace !! 💪👍🙏

About 40% of California's electricity comes from fossil fuels. The carbon footprint of the batteries, motor and other parts is huge, so much so that a Tesla car on average takes 8 years to break even with a conventional car. Cobalt used in the lithium ion batteries is mined by child labour in Africa, and seriously impacts their health. Finally the aura of a VW van with its 4 pot boxer engine is being lost to posterity by vandalising it like this. In short, I do not approve, but being a curious person, I am fascinated to find out how your project turns out.
